text: Hey guys, a client just asked me if I can build an ecommerce website on HubSpot and wondering what a common setup for ecommerce + HubSpot looks like - is it normally a situation where the ecomm store is hosted on Shopify (or similar platform) and then uses HubSpot to create a marketing website to leverage buyer purchase behavior based on HubSpot CRM data? I would imagine HubSpot CMS isn't the place to build the ecommerce store itself (maybe I'm wrong though) but can be a powerful marketing tool if properly integrated with the ecommerce store.
<https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/ecommerce/shopify>
Yep I just suggested they go with a Shopify + HubSpot stack - thanks for sharing!

Hi <@UFL9XN2DQ>! Hope you are well. We’ve been in the HubSpot marketplace with a Shopify -> HubSpot integration since 2015. We sync a lot more data than the Shopify Native integration linked above.

<https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/ecommerce/unific>
We also add RFM calculations to that data and automatically create a number of workflows and lists that are made to transform HubSpot into an ecommerce marketing system
The jQuery dependency was removed! :D
Is there an easy way to see how many blog posts are currently published in a HS blog?
```{{ blog_total_post_count(<id>) }}```
That is easy!
I was hoping for something in the backend, but that works well too
Ah, in the interface - im not sure, sorry! :slightly_smiling_face:
No need to apologize.  I actually just needed the count for an end of year report, so that worked fine
internal report or do we get to see the work of sir ian mcllwain?
That would be an internal report for our content team
We’re annoyingly close to 1m blog views for the year
:eyes:
need 27k in the next couple of weeks
i will start reading post haste

firing up the bots
That time I accidentally DDoSd my own site to try to boost traffic
ha!

but that would be pretty hilarious
a good end of year case study
Wordpress plugin not working keeps cycling the login page
am I missing something?
`content/api/v2/blog-posts?portalId=<portalId>&content_group_id=<blogId>`
LOL
bah!!!

Experienced this in some form before on a high traffic site - there was a deployment and suddenly all of our database connections jumped up. Turned out some broken code was deployed for a tracking library - it essentially created an iframe with a blank src… and because it’s html, blank = open the same page again.
<iframe src=“#“></iframe>, ddosed ourselves :smile:

Can any of the HS engineers in here speak to why merging contacts re-enrolls them into _some_ workflows? It seems to be limited to just workflows that involve an email step (but I’m not positive about that).

I’m assuming there’s some reason behind this behavior, and I’d like to understand what it is. Because 1) it’s really unfortunate when you discover that you just inadvertently sent a flurry of content download emails to a contact you merged from forms they submitted months before, and 2) if I’m going to build workarounds into our automation, it’d be really helpful to know exactly what situations will trigger these re-enrollments
No. I'm trying to build a marketing emails and catalog.
